0.cdata!:
Mauritanie - Programme de Développement
            Urbain : cadre de politique de reinstallation

trustfund:
TF026223-PHRD-SLUM UPGRADING AND URBAN
            POVERTY ALLEVIATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Urban Development Project (PDU) aims
            at: (i) improving the living environment in urban areas,
            particularly for low-income households, (ii) the promotion
            of economic activities and employment, and (iii) capacity
            building institutional urban planning, land tenure,
            management of urban environmental services and
            decentralization. The program should run in two phases.
            Until the start of Phase 2 of the PDU, a complementary
            program was initiated and has additional funding from IDA.
            This additional program will focus on achieving the
            following infrastructure: roads and drainage, water supply
            and electrification. In carrying out activities under the
            additional financing of the PDU, the activities of road and
            drainage, water supply and electrification could lead to
            negative social. The negative social impacts that might
            occur include: (i) disruption of commercial activities and
            crafts (canteens, shops, workshops and garages), (ii) loss
            of agricultural land and crops (borders of fields and
            orchards, as in the case in the town of Rosso), (iii) the
            destruction of domestic infrastructure (boundary wall,
            septic latrines, etc.).
